nodes.bodyText: We also had to a new concept in another test case and decided to add it in ASwtBotTestCase instead of the concrete test case. Not sure if it makes sense for this concept, because I don't know if there are other UseCases we could run SWT tests for with this concept.

I would rather put the core concepts ( tests / core / ps ) into ATestCase but not this concept as it is really about some domain content... And what benefit would we have if it would be in the ATestCase?
Ok then we leave it there
Can we remove the empty Strings?
Well, it's the simplest way that I know how to convert the double values to strings...

I actually agree that using + "" to convert to String isnt the nicest way.
I would suggest String.valueOf(AOCS_POWER).  It may be a little bit longer in terms of number of characters, but this makes it really clear for the reader whats being done.
I think we have a save function in ASwtBotTestCase we could call instead?

If we open the powerSummary I think we can use the SWTBot API to do the assertion with something like this:
assertText(expectedMinPower, bot.textWithLabel(PowerSummary.PROPERTY_MINPOWER));
(or something similar)
In general it looks a bit weird that the before part opens the PowerSummary editor and then this test case opens the configuration tree editor.
Ah ok, I thought that I was supposed to test, if the power summary in the configuration tree editor is showing the correct numbers.

Why do we need this save here?
Would it not be sufficient to save at the end of the test setup?
